title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and mix in the grated cheeses and plenty of black pepper.
In a large pan, cook the pancetta until crispy, then remove from heat.
Drain the pasta, reserving a cup of the cooking water.
Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the pancetta, then add the egg and cheese mixture, tossing rapidly.
Add a splash of the reserved cooking water to create a creamy sauce.
Season with salt if needed and serve immediately with extra grated cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, 1 tsp cumin, cinnamon, and cayenne for 1 hour.
Grill chicken until juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side.
In a large pan, melt butter and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in remaining cumin and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add cream and bring to a simmer.
Add grilled chicken and simmer for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of fresh vegetables stir-fried with garlic and soy sauce.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add vegetables starting with the ones that take longer to cook (carrots, broccoli).
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add bell pepper and snap peas, stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Toss everything together and cook for 1 more minute.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

title: Classic Burger
summary: Juicy beef patty with cheese, lettuce, and special sauce on a toasted bun.
instructions: In a bowl, mix ground beef with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Divide into 4 equal portions and form into patties slightly larger than your buns.
Make a small indentation in the center of each patty to prevent bulging.
Preheat grill or pan over medium-high heat.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side for medium.
Add cheese during the last minute of cooking.
Toast the buns lightly.
Assemble burgers with your favorite toppings and condiments.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Crisp romaine lettuce with garlic croutons, parmesan, and creamy Caesar dressing.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and Dijon mustard.
Slowly whisk in olive oil until emulsified.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
In a large bowl, combine romaine lettuce and half of the dressing.
Toss to coat the leaves evenly.
Add croutons and most of the parmesan, reserving some for garnish.
Toss again and add more dressing if needed.
Garnish with remaining parmesan and serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
summary: Warm chocolate cake with a gooey, molten center, served with vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: Butter and cocoa powder for ramekins
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Butter 4 ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter together in a heatproof bowl over simmering water.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until pale and thick.
Fold the melted chocolate into the egg mixture.
Sift in flour and salt, and fold until just combined.
Divide the batter among the prepared ramekins.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until the edges are set but the center is still soft.
Let sit for 1 minute, then invert onto plates.
Serve immediately with vanilla ice cream.

title: Jollof Rice with Chicken
summary: Aromatic one-pot rice dish cooked in a rich tomato and pepper sauce, served with fried chicken.
instructions: Season chicken with salt, pepper, and half of the thyme. Let marinate for 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat oil and brown chicken pieces. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onions until translucent. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add blended tomatoes, peppers, tomato paste, and spices. Cook until sauce thickens.
Add rice and stir to coat with the sauce. Pour in chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes until rice is cooked.
Return chicken to the pot during the last 15 minutes of cooking.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving. Fluff with a fork and serve hot.

title: Waakye
summary: A hearty dish of rice and beans cooked in millet leaves, served with a variety of sides.
ingredients: 10-12 dried millet leaves (waakye leaves) or 2 tea bags
For serving: gari, spaghetti, fried plantains, boiled eggs, shito (pepper sauce), and salad
instructions: Soak beans overnight or for at least 4 hours. Drain and rinse.
In a large pot, combine beans, millet leaves, and enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until beans are tender but not mushy.
Add rice, baking soda, and salt. Add more water if needed (about 1 inch above rice level).
Cover and cook on low heat for 25-30 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Remove millet leaves and fluff the rice with a fork.
Serve hot with your choice of sides like gari, spaghetti, fried plantains, boiled eggs, shito, and salad.

title: Banku with Okro Soup
summary: Fermented corn and cassava dough balls served with a flavorful okra soup and fish.
instructions: For the banku: Mix corn dough and cassava dough with water to make a smooth paste.
Allow to ferment for 1-3 days in a warm place (or use instant banku mix).
In a non-stick pot, cook the fermented dough over medium heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon.
Add water as needed to prevent burning and achieve a smooth, stretchy consistency.
For the soup: Heat palm oil in a pot and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger.
Add blended tomatoes and cook until thickened. Add fish and enough water to cover.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then add chopped okra and peppers. Cook for another 5-10 minutes.
Season with salt and serve hot with banku.

title: Kelewele
summary: Spicy fried plantains, a popular Ghanaian street food snack.
instructions: Peel plantains and cut into bite-sized cubes.
In a large bowl, mix all spices with grated onion, ginger, and garlic.
Add plantain pieces to the spice mixture and toss to coat evenly. Let marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.
Fry plantains in batches until golden brown and crispy on the outside, about 3-4 minutes per batch.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot as a snack or side dish.
